intro: Elaterium ribiflorum, commonly known as the red-flowered elaterium, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Elatinaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of bright red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas, making it a common sight in woodland edges and stream banks. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
